How often do you find you have to preform moderation duties such as locking bad threads or editing/removing posts?

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Benjamin Kerman said:
> 
> 
> How often do you find you have to preform moderation duties such as locking bad threads or editing/removing posts?
> 

There's always plenty to do, honestly. The moderation team does a good job of taking action when it needs to, and as a result sometimes, I think, the forum population at large doesn't even realize how much the moderators actually do behind the scenes. I certainly didn't realized until I joined up.

The posts of new members go into a queue, where they are either approved or banned as spambots. The queue fills at roughly 2-10 posts per hour and must be cleared out several times per day.

We receive anywhere from zero to perhaps 10 reports per day, which we review, discuss amongst ourselves, and either leave alone or act upon. The action may include moving, warning, or warning and hiding from public view, or it may call for a reply. Less commonly, it might be split into a new thread, or merged into an existing one. Several times per week for those.  

We also each read a fair fraction of the forum's content ourselves, and actually find more issues that way than are reported to us. Threads submitted to the wrong subs, for example, are more often found by mods than reported to us. We move between zero and 10 of these per day. 

When we can, we also greet new members and answer player's questions about the game and the forum. 

I myself typically spend 1-4 hours per day on these activities.
